meanings.definition: To exchange one thing for another.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy swopping my toys with my friends.
meanings.sent2: People often swop items at a flea market.
meanings.sent3: The siblings were swopping candies, giggling happily.
meanings.sent4: In the game, players swop roles to keep things interesting.
meanings.sent5: The students were swopping books to read different stories.

meanings.definition: The act of trading or exchanging goods or services.
meanings.sent1: Swopping can be a fun way to get new things.
meanings.sent2: At the market, there was a lot of swopping happening.
meanings.sent3: The swopping of gifts during the holidays brought joy to all.
meanings.sent4: The swopping of ideas led to a creative collaboration.
meanings.sent5: The community's swopping of skills helped everyone learn something new.
